Articles.Content:
Okay, so recently, I found a neat bug in KSP.

My only thought after discovering this bug was, "What would Danny2462 do?"

Let me know what you think! Constructive criticism is welcome.

Happy watching!

Pretty good! That's a neat bug you found there! Here's some things I liked:

  • The background music adds a lot. Good job there!
  • I liked how you used outlined text in the IVA to make it readable against the whites and blacks.
  • You kept your video nice and short.

I have a few suggestions for improvement though:

  • Try adding a bit more content to your video. All you showed in your video was the VAB and launchpad. Try pretending you were just landing on the Mun or something when you noticed this. Use HyperEdit to make things easier if you want.
  • Often times you leave the text visible for too long on the screen (you left "BEST GLITCH EVER" on the screen for ~11 seconds). And just generally all the text in general could have progressed a bit faster. People read faster than you'd think.
  • The part at the end where you say "I should probably feel less proud than I do right now" probably wasn't necessary. Or you could have displayed it over top of some gameplay.
  • The music, at least at the beginning, could have been more of a "happy-go-lucky" style. Try browsing the YouTube music library for tons of free music (then you won't have to deal with copyright stuff).

But good job! I liked it.

Edited January 9, 2014 by Andrew Hansen

Noted. Thanks for the suggestions.

In reality, I could have put a lot more work into this video. I shot and edited everything in ~30 minutes. In the future, my main suggestion to myself would be to spend more time and effort on the thing. (Although I'll definitely try to speed up text. I didn't know that I was leaving it up on the screen for too long.)

Does anyone else have any suggestions? They would be much appreciated
